ygData.subject: RE: RE: mana
ygData.msgSnippet: If I had chosen a Dwarf, I would have dumped ALL the points I could into WIS. Their base STR and STA are exceptional compared to the other races to choose
ygData.messageBody:
If I had chosen a Dwarf, I would have dumped ALL the points I could into
WIS. Their base STR and STA are exceptional compared to the other races to
choose from. Alas, I chose a Dark Elf, so I had to spend several points
getting my STR and STA up to a comfortable level. You should be fine though,
103 WIS is a good base. You will find plenty of items, and have good quests
to get great WIS items.

Drizben D'Vorn
Defiled Priest of Innoruuk
Loyal Knight of Oblivion


> From: Patrick Trant <telikas@...>
>
> 170 wisdom?!?! Ack...that has to be a joke for me.
> With my base wisdom of 103 and me being fairly new,
> the only way I will be able to get wisdom items is
> from killing the mobs myself (which means I will have
> to be fairly high to even get any good items)...Being
> new I can't afford them items as of now; plus I hear
> we clerics are very poor for a LONG while cause we
> have to buy armor and spells...which so far seems to
> be true. In all honestly did I do the right thing by
> putting my strength up to 100 (I read a guide that
> said I should so I could wear full plate) or should I
> have just pilled all my points in wisdom?
>
> Niomar, Dwarven Cleric of the 10th Training. Xegony.
> Telikas, Dark Elven mage of the 14th Training.
> Xegony.
>
> P.S. Am writting from work so have a different email
> address...
>
>
